sentences.en: "A cashmere sweater still thrills me," she admits. "It has wonderful staying power; it looks chic and modern."
sentences.cn: “羊绒衫仍是我的最爱，”她承认，“它不会过时，看起来既漂亮又时尚。”

sentences.en: At Chanel, cocktail dresses and evening wear were black and chic.
sentences.cn: 在“香奈儿”展秀上, 尽是色黑质雅的短礼裙和晚装.

sentences.en: Frisee became one of the chic staples of 1980 s cookery.
sentences.cn: 菊苣成了八十年代烹调艺术流行主要材料之一.

sentences.en: He pronounced them to perfection with genuine Parisian chic.
sentences.cn: 他念音非常准确,是纯粹的巴黎调子.

sentences.en: Her clothes told me nothing: they were about as nondescript and lacking in chic as it was possible to be.
sentences.cn: 从她的衣着上什么也看不出来：全是大路货，毫无时髦优雅之处。

sentences.en: Her gown was very French and very chic.
sentences.cn: 她的礼服颇具法国风情，非常别致。

sentences.en: Long tie belt threads through double belt loops for a chic look.
sentences.cn: 同色系的双扣缎带幽幽的泛着光,是这款孕裤的亮点所在;裤腿处搭配精密缝合,身后还设有纽扣,让穿着更加 舒适,也使得风格更加独特.

sentences.en: Margaret was looking very chic in blue.
sentences.cn: 玛格丽特穿着蓝色的衣服看上去很优雅。

sentences.en: She is always so chic, so elegant.
sentences.cn: 她总是那么时髦，那么优雅。
她穿着时髦的卡其布服装.

sentences.en: She wears her clothes with chic.
Sophie looked chic in lime green and navy.
sentences.cn: 索菲身着酸橙绿和海军蓝，显得很时尚。

sentences.en: The reason why children are cheap furniture, with its well - chic design inseparable.
sentences.cn: 儿童家具之所以价格不菲, 与其精心别致的设计密不可分.

sentences.en: Tousled hair and designer stubble are chic.
sentences.cn: 乱蓬蓬的头发和时兴的胡茬都很新潮。

sentences.en: With simple supplies like scrap book paper and paint, you can easily convert them into chic and affordable gift boxes, flower vases or handy dispensers.
sentences.cn: 用废书刊剪报或者涂料，你可以很容易地将其转换成别致的并且负担得起的礼品盒，花瓶或简易分类罐。

words.tran_cn: 矫揉；时髦的人；过度精巧的东西

trans.tran_cn: <法>漂亮的，时髦的，潇洒的，别致的
trans.tran_en: very fashionable and expensive, and showing good judgement of what is attractive and good style

trans.tran_cn: 别致的款式(尤指妇女的服饰)
trans.tran_en: Chic is used to refer to a particular style or to the quality of being chic
